hook.text: Five thousand years ago, people dragged 25-ton stones 150 miles to build a monument. Nobody is sure why.

buildup.text: Stonehenge's bluestones were quarried in Wales and transported to Salisbury Plainâ€”an extraordinary feat.

discovery.text: The monument aligns with the summer and winter solstices. It was almost certainly an astronomical observatory.

twist.text: Recent excavations found cremated remains of over 60 people. Stonehenge may also have been a cemetery for elites.

climax.text: After decades of study, experts still debate: temple, observatory, healing site, or all three at once?

punchline.text: The stones have stood for 5,000 years. The answer hasn't.

quiz.question: What astronomical alignment does Stonehenge demonstrate?
options: It points toward the North Star
It aligns with the summer and winter solstices
It tracks the phases of the moon
